intro: Xanthosia rhomboidea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Xanthosia rhomboidea is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it an important plant in soil enrichment and sustainable agriculture.
